Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a graphic circulating on social media and tweets from unreliable sources.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all the accused in the Hyderabad rape case were from the Muslim community, which is not supported by evidence.
Exist alternative explanation: The police and family members of the accused have provided alternative explanations and refuted the claim that all the accused were from the Muslim community.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the accused were identified by the police and their family members, who confirmed that they belonged to different religious communities.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the religious aspect of the case by falsely attributing the religious identity of the accused.
Understate: No understatement bias is evident in the claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by relying on misinformation spread on social media and unreliable sources.
